intro: Coussarea colonis, commonly known as the Madagascar evergreen, is a shrub or small tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. It produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Coussarea colonis is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
